channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Ex-FBI Director James Comey indicted on criminal charges stemming from 2020 testimony
item.description: Comey faces one count of making false statements and one count of obstruction of justice in connection.

item.title: What the recognition of a Palestinian state means to Palestinians
item.description: Several countries have made moves to recognize Palestinian statehood. What do these announcements mean practically for Palestinians and are these declarations coming too little too late?

item.title: Colorado's largest utility agrees to settle lawsuit over claims it sparked wildfire
item.description: Colorado's largest utility company has agreed to pay about $640 million to settle a lawsuit over liability for the state's most destructive wildfire, the Marshall fire in 2021.

item.title: Dogs take over a public pool in North Carolina
item.description: Once a year in Wilmington North Carolina, dogs who love water take over the public pool for the annual Pooch Plunge.

item.title: Could a 'silver tsunami' of aging Americans fix the housing crisis?
item.description: The "silver tsunami" of aging Americans is often seen as a potential way to alleviate U.S. housing affordability woes. But an influx of empty-nester homes into the market may not have much impact.

item.title: On the frontlines of Mississippi's infant mortality crisis
item.description: Public health officials in Mississippi recently declared a crisis around infant mortality. Too many babies are dying. Officials are working to help pregnant moms get access to better prenatal care.

item.title: Hegseth summons military top brass to unusual meeting, agenda unclear
item.description: Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth has summoned hundreds of general and admirals from across the globe to a meeting in Virginia.Â But there's no word on why the highly unusual meeting has been called.

item.title: EU defense ministers to discuss a better defense against mysterious drones
item.description: Drones were spotted over four of Denmark's civilian and military airports in the second mystery sighting this week. European Union defense ministers will hold a virtual meeting Friday to discuss this.

item.title: Three months later, a survivor reflects on the Texas floods
item.description: Three months after floods hit central Texas, senior editor at Texas Monthly Aaron Parsley shares his experience when he and his family were swept away by rushing water and how they're moving forward.

item.title: With 831 Stories, romance fans get more than a steamy read
item.description: 831 Stories is all-in on the romance genre, and the founders are cultivating a whole world around the books they publish, complete with fanfiction and merchandise.
